notable_strengths: CSS changes follow established table-layout patterns
Inline styles in VariantService.ts align with existing inline style usage
TypeScript types maintained without introducing new 'any' types
notable_risks: 17 console.log statements added that violate ESLint no-console rule
Multiple unnecessary try-catch fallback blocks added
Debug code left in production paths
quick_wins: Remove unnecessary try-catch blocks that silently handle errors

inferred_rules: Production code should not contain console.log statements
ESLint configured to warn on console.log usage (only console.error and console.warn allowed)
Main branch has zero console.log statements in tracks directory

evidence.note: Main branch has 0 console.log, feature branch adds 17

inferred_rules: Existing try-catch blocks handle specific known cases (e.g., getBBox() not ready)
No pattern of using try-catch for general fallback mechanisms

evidence.note: Main branch has specific try-catch for getBBox(), not general fallbacks

inferred_rules: Errors should be handled explicitly, not silently swallowed
Console.error allowed for actual error conditions

evidence.note: console.error explicitly allowed in ESLint config

inferred_rules: ESLint with TypeScript plugin for type checking
Styles in CSS files, inline styles used sparingly for dynamic values

evidence.note: All track implementations in dedicated directory

findings.issue: 17 console.log debug statements added throughout the file
findings.why_it_matters: Violates ESLint no-console rule and leaves debug artifacts in production code

evidence.note: Lines with console.log: DrawTrack() START, variant data filtering, DEBUG outputs

findings.recommendation: Remove all console.log statements before merging

findings.issue: Unnecessary try-catch block added for sorting with fallback
findings.why_it_matters: Silently swallows errors and continues execution, masking potential issues

evidence.note: Try-catch around featureChildren.sort() with console.error fallback

findings.recommendation: Remove try-catch, handle undefined names directly without exception handling

findings.issue: Another try-catch block for children sorting with silent failure
findings.why_it_matters: Pattern of adding unnecessary error recovery instead of fixing root cause
findings.recommendation: Remove try-catch, ensure sortWeight values are properly initialized

findings.issue: Inline styles added directly to HTML string generation
findings.why_it_matters: While following existing pattern, increases CSS-in-JS coupling
findings.recommendation: Consider moving all tooltip styles to CSS classes in future refactor

notes: Repository uses TypeScript with strict mode enabled
ESLint configured with no-console rule (only error/warn allowed)
Multiple debug artifacts and unnecessary fallback mechanisms introduced
